TopicTitle: i have been having some problems with ksp with bugs and error(occurring before i installed mods) plz help

Articles.Content:
I ever since i installed KSP on my new computer i have been having errors and bugs like solar and heat panels exploding on launch and 1min long repeating error messages in the console when i crash a craft lagging my game, when i installed the patcher today and i tried to fix my game i received two error messages and the two loading bars stayed at 0% an it instantly said press OK to exit, after two CMD windows came up and game me ownership over all the files in my directory(wich i already owned but ok) and then it closed, i would like to know if that is whats supposed to happen or if something went wrong.

Also i now have basically every mod made for 1.2.2 that does not add planets, and this is at the same time as trying to patch the game.

i do not use Steam edition

9 hours ago, SYDWAD said:

i installed the patcher today and i tried to fix my game...

Don't use the patcher, it's servers are down and SQUAD has abandoned it.
What version of KSP do you have? The current release doesn't include that patcher any more...
I'd download a fresh copy of KSP from the store and reinstall, if I were you.

Edited April 24, 2017 by steve_v

3 minutes ago, steve_v said:

Don't use the patcher, it's servers are down and SQUAD has abandoned it.
What version of KSP do you have? The current release doesn't include that patcher any more...
I'd download a fresh copy of KSP from the store and reinstall, if I were you.

Uuuugh but that takes sooo long

3 minutes ago, SYDWAD said:

Uuuugh but that takes sooo long

Yeah, I know. That's why the angry face.
I really don't see how maintaining an rsync based patcher can be too hard, but that's an old argument, and I got nowhere with it.
SQUAD's not interested. The only valid reason I can think of is that nobody there can do native code... even stupidly simple native code.

Edited April 24, 2017 by steve_v

1 minute ago, steve_v said:

Yeah, I know. That's why the angry face.
I really don't see how maintaining an rsync based patcher can be too hard, but that's an old argument, and I got nowhere with it. SQUAD's not interested.

Tru, maybe the cost to maintain the servers was too high for how fiew people used it? All it really is is just a system that looks at ye files and a copy.

Just now, SYDWAD said:

All it really is is just a system that looks at ye files and a copy.

Not even that. It's just a pretty frontend for rsync, and rsync does all the work. I've transferred entire servers with rsync, updating a game is childs play by comparison.
